Tampering.description: An attacker can modify your build system and produce signed builds of your software.
Tampering.OWASP ASVS: V14.2 Verify the integrity of build tools and environments.

Tampering.description: An attacker can take advantage of your custom key exchange or integrity control which you built instead of using standard crypto.
Tampering.OWASP ASVS: V3.1 Verify standard algorithms and key lengths are used.

Tampering.description: Your code makes access control decisions all over the place, rather than with a security kernel.
Tampering.OWASP ASVS: V4.1 Verify centralized access control management.

Tampering.description: An attacker can replay data without detection because your code doesn't provide timestamps or sequence numbers.
Tampering.MITRE ATT&CK: T1565.003 - Data Manipulation: Data from Untrusted Sources
Tampering.OWASP ASVS: V10.11 Ensure replay attacks are mitigated.

Tampering.description: An attacker can write to a data store your code relies on.
Tampering.OWASP ASVS: V13.2 Verify authorization checks are in place for data access.

Tampering.description: An attacker can bypass permissions because you don't make names canonical before checking access permissions.
Tampering.MITRE ATT&CK: T1222.001 - File and Directory Permissions Modification: Linux and Mac
Tampering.OWASP ASVS: V4.3 Verify canonicalization processes.

Tampering.description: An attacker can manipulate data because there's no integrity protection for data on the network.
Tampering.MITRE ATT&CK: T1565.002 - Data Manipulation: Transmitted Data Manipulation
Tampering.OWASP ASVS: V7.4 Verify integrity protection for data transmission.

Tampering.description: An attacker can provide or control state information.
Tampering.MITRE ATT&CK: T1553.004 - Hijack Execution Flow: Web Session Cookie
Tampering.OWASP ASVS: V3.7 Verify state management security.

Tampering.description: An attacker can alter information in a data store because it has weak/open permissions or includes a group which is equivalent to everyone ('anyone with a Facebook account').
Tampering.MITRE ATT&CK: T1222.001 - File and Directory Permissions Modification: Linux and Mac
Tampering.OWASP ASVS: V13.1 Verify strong data store access control.

Tampering.description: An attacker can write to some resource because permissions are granted to the world or there are no ACLs.
Tampering.MITRE ATT&CK: T1222.001 - File and Directory Permissions Modification: Linux and Mac
Tampering.OWASP ASVS: V4.1 Verify access control rules are effective and enforce principles of least privilege.

Tampering.description: An attacker can change parameters over a trust boundary and after validation (for example, important parameters in a hidden field in HTML, or passing a pointer to critical memory).
Tampering.OWASP ASVS: V5.2 Verify all inputs are validated.

Tampering.description: An attacker can load code inside your process via an extension point.
Tampering.MITRE ATT&CK: T1505.003 - Server-Side Request Forgery: Web Services
Tampering.OWASP ASVS: V1.14 Verify the use of sandboxing for third-party plugins.

Tampering.description: An attacker injects malicious code into the source repository to alter the application's behavior without detection.
Tampering.OWASP ASVS: V14.2 Verify integrity of source code repositories.

Tampering.description: A threat actor modifies encryption routines to weaken cryptographic operations and facilitate decryption.
Tampering.OWASP ASVS: V3.2 Verify that standard cryptographic algorithms are implemented correctly.

Tampering.description: An attacker exploits inadequate input validation to overwrite application data via a buffer overflow attack.
Tampering.OWASP ASVS: V5.1 Verify input validation to prevent buffer overflows.

Tampering.description: A hacker alters database queries within the application to bypass business logic and manipulate data access.
Tampering.OWASP ASVS: V6.5 Verify all database queries are secured.

Tampering.description: An adversary modifies the application's runtime environment to execute unauthorized commands or access data.
Tampering.OWASP ASVS: V1.11 Ensure runtime environments are secured.

Tampering.description: An attacker alters API endpoints to redirect users to malicious destinations or intercept data.
Tampering.OWASP ASVS: V14.4 Ensure API security through proper routing and validation.

Tampering.description: An attacker manipulates file permissions on shared resources to gain unauthorized access to sensitive data.
Tampering.MITRE ATT&CK: T1222.002 - File and Directory Permissions Modification: Windows
Tampering.OWASP ASVS: V13.3 Verify access control settings on files and databases.

Tampering.description: A cybercriminal alters log files to hide evidence of an ongoing attack or past intrusions.
Tampering.OWASP ASVS: V7.3 Verify integrity and security of logging mechanisms.

Tampering.description: An attacker changes network device configurations to reroute traffic through a monitored gateway.
Tampering.OWASP ASVS: V12.3 Verify security of network device configurations.

Tampering.description: A threat actor inserts malicious code into third-party libraries used by the application to leverage widespread vulnerabilities.
Tampering.OWASP ASVS: V14.2 Verify third-party components are from trusted and reviewed sources.
